events.name: McLaren x DSSG Meetup (Machine health and human performance monitoring)
events.description: Hi all,  NOTE: Please refer to the new attendance policy before RSVP to this meetup. RSVP will only open on 19th Apr, Tuesday (12pm) and closes on 25th Apr(12pm).  We are proud to have Cao Hong (Head of Analytics, APAC) to share with us their insights in applications of data science at McLaren! 6.45pm-7.15pm: Networking session [casual; small talk]  7.15pm-8.00pm: Cao Hong, Head of Analytics APAC , “Changing the Game with Data and Insights" [core; industry applications of data science]  Title:  Change the Game with Data and Analytics Synopsis:  McLaren Applied Technologies (M.A.T) is a global engineering and technology company set up to harness significant R&D, technical expertise and innovation spirit that have kept McLaren racing at the pinnacle of elite motorsport for five decades. M.A.T has now extended this knowledge and approach to lift the performance of and inspire innovation in blue-chip companies, like-minded pioneers and visionaries. In this talk, I will introduce M.A.T’s story and its fundamental technological approach that is underpinned by data and analytics, to help our partners lift the performances in various industrial verticals. I will also overview our current development in human performance/condition monitoring and predictive machine health with succinct case studies. [] : Suggested rating and topic; ranges from:newbie - casual - core - hardcore RSVP will only open on 19th Apr, Tuesday (12pm) and closes on 25th Apr(12pm).
events.location: #03-04, IDA Labs@NDC 111 Middle Road, National Design Centre, Singapore 188969., IDA Labs@NDC 111 Middle Road, National Design Centre

events.name: Talk.CSS #5
events.description: Our next meet-up will be on 26 April at Viki Singapore. Latest CSS news by Talk.CSSOur new regular segment which will cover latest updates in the realm of CSS and HTML. Structuring and Organising SCSS Files by Joel PanThe more you learn and use SCSS, the larger your SCSS files get. How do you organise your definitions to make everything more manageable? No Fear by Chris LienertIt’s a UX talk, but aimed at designers and developers.¯\_(ツ)_/¯ Also, if you want to do a lightning talk, please let us know before the event starts. We're more than happy to slot you in. Any CSS-related topics at ANY level are welcome because we're all here to learn and share. :) =========================================== General info We try to keep our timing tight so make sure you arrive close to the start time. Use the hash tag #SingaporeCSS whenever the urge comes.  Even if you're not a speaker this time, and get a sudden flash of inspiration, we welcome lightning talks too. Just poke us before the event starts and we'll slot you in. Lastly, if you want to speak or help out with anything, please contact Hui Jing or Chris.
events.location: Rakuten Viki, 138 Market Street, Lv.32, Singapore

events.name: April Meetup
events.description: Hi folks!  We look forward to having you join us for our April meetup, on the 26th, venue @ Carousell, 71 Ayer Rajah Crescent, #05-14 Singapore 139951. We're still looking for speakers! Ping us (Winston or Guo Xiang) if your company would like to sponsoror if you'd like to do a 10-15min talk or 5 Random Ruby Tips.  See you on the 26th! Venue:  Carousell, 71 Ayer Rajah Crescent, #03-14 Singapore 139951 -------------- 1. "Docker and Ruby Development" by Soedar from Ministry of Education  2.  "Superlogger - Custom Logging for Rails" by Yu Ming from Ministry of Education 3. "5 Random Ruby Tips" by @tgxworld from @discourse 4. Announcements * Hot Picks- This is a 5-10 minutes session during which anyone canstand up and say something interesting!  -------------- Would you like to speak at our future meetups? You could share about your startup technology stack,your new RubyGem, or your opinions on best practices,so that people can get to know how awesome you are! We also have a 5min section on "5 Random Ruby Tips"that you can volunteer for - I am sure you must havecame across some interesting Ruby nuggets in thelast month right? So don't be shy! Step forward and share your knowledge! Ping Winston @winstonyw / winstonyw@gmail.com,or Guo Xiang @tgx_world / tgx_world@hotmail.com See you all soon! --------------Job Postings-------------- Are you looking for Rubyists? Do you have a job posting?Email us a blurb (< 50 words) + link and we'll put it her -------------- Thank You, Sponsors! Venue, Food and Drinks:
